Yes, Apple Inc. has made several recent acquisitions and partnerships that have brought them numerous benefits. Here are a few examples:

1. Acquisition of Shazam: In 2018, Apple acquired the music recognition app Shazam, which has over 1 billion downloads. This acquisition allowed Apple to integrate Shazam's technology into their products, such as the Apple Music app, to help users identify songs more easily. It also gave Apple access to Shazam's vast data on music preferences, which they can use for personalized recommendations.

2. Partnership with Amazon: In 2019, Apple and Amazon announced a partnership that allowed the Apple Music app to be available on Amazon's Echo devices. This gave millions of Amazon users access to Apple Music's library of over 70 million songs, which was previously only available on Apple's devices. It also allowed Apple to expand its reach to a wider audience.

3. Acquisition of Voysis: In 2020, Apple acquired Voysis, an Irish artificial intelligence start-up that specializes in voice recognition technology. This acquisition is expected to improve Siri's voice recognition capabilities and make it more competitive with other virtual assistants like Google Assistant and Alexa.

Overall, these acquisitions and partnerships have helped Apple expand its offerings, improve its technology, and reach new audiences.
